noun.description: The protective care of God or of nature as a spiritual power.
examples: they found their trust in divine providence to be a source of comfort

proper noun.description: The capital of Rhode Island, a port near the mouth of the Providence River, on the Atlantic coast; population 171,557 (est. 2008). It was founded in 1636 by Roger Williams (1604–83) as a haven for religious dissenters.

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French, from Latin providentia, from providere foresee, attend to (see provide).
